showScoreExcerpt:
"Although an often touching play, this mostly reverent revival never fully envelops you...The stage is so huge for such an intimate piece...Instead of bringing the family together in crisis, it places them in separate voids...The play works best when it deals with the intimate subjects like the path the two sisters took...The performances shine...One wonders if 'Marvinâ€™s Room' could have been much more immediate and immersive had it played at the more intimate Laura Pels Theatre."
